div.p: Have these peaceful clerics even considered that they're subverting a most holy system, one where bad decisions coincide with the teaching power of pain?

description.p: The balm of peace thrives at the heart of healthy communities, between friendly nations, and in the souls of the kindhearted. The gods of peace inspire people of all sorts to resolve conflict and to stand up against those forces that try to prevent peace from flourishing. See the Peace Deities table for a list of some of the gods associated with this domain.

Clerics of the Peace Domain preside over the signing of treaties, and they are often asked to arbitrate in disputes. These clerics' blessings draw people together and help them shoulder one another's burdens, and the clerics' magic aids those who are driven to fight for the way of peace.

Law establishes hierarchies. Those selected by the law to lead must be obeyed. Those who obey must do so to the best of their ability. In this manner, law creates an intricate web of obligations that allows society to forge order and security in a chaotic multiverse.

sheet.description: The Order Domain represents discipline, as well as devotion to a society or an institution and strict obedience to the laws governing it.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Peace Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

td.em: aura of purity, Otiluke's resilient sphere

description.p: You gain proficiency in the Insight, Performance, or Persuasion skill (your choice).

sheet.description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor. You also gain proficiency in the Intimidation or Persuasion skill.

description.p: You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another. As an action, you choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to your proficiency bonus. You create a magical bond among them for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again. While any bonded creature is within 30 feet of another, the creature can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw it makes. Each creature can add the d4 no more than once per turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Choose up to {{emboldening bond:creatures}} with 30ft of you. For 10 minutes (or until used this skill again), while at {{emboldening bond:range}}ft of another bonded creature, can roll d4 and add result to an attack, ability or saving throw roll. Each creature can only add a d4 once per turn.

description.p: You can use your Channel Divinity to make your very presence a soothing balm. As an action, you can move up to your speed, without provoking opportunity attacks, and when you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this action, you can restore a number of hit points to that creature equal to 2d6 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). A creature can receive this healing only once whenever you take this action.

sheet.description: Move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks, when you're withing 5ft of any other creature, you can restore 2d6+{{wisdom:modifier}} (minimum of 1 hit point) hit points to that creature. A creature can receive this healing only one whenever you take this action.

description.p: The bond you forge between people helps them protect each other. When a creature affected by your Emboldening Bond feature is about to take damage, a second bonded creature within 30 feet of the first can use its reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the first creature. The second creature then takes all the damage instead.

sheet.description: When bonded creature will take damage, second bonded creature within {{protective bond:range}}ft can teleport by using their reaction within 5ft of the first. The second creature takes all the damage instead.

description.p: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: Add {{wisdom:modifier}} to damage dealt with a cleric cantrip.

description.p: The benefits of your Emboldening Bond and Protective Bond features now work when the creatures are within 60 feet of each other. Moreover, when a creature uses Protective Bond to take someone else's damage, the creature has resistance to that damage.

sheet.description: The benefits of Emboldening Bond and Protective Bond work with creatures within {{expansive bond:range}}ft of each other. Also, when creature uses Protective Bond to receive damage, it gains resistance to that damage.
